abstract: Government of Burundi holds parliamentary and local elections as scheduled, despite international calls to postpone them due to gunfire and grenade attacks night before; turnout is small and last-minute changes in polling centers adds to confusion; international groups, including African Union and European Union, withdraw observers.
lead_paragraph: Despite international calls for the postponement of parliamentary and local balloting, the government pressed ahead, saying that a delay would only add to instability.

headline.main: Burundi Holds Elections After Night of Gunfire and Grenade Attacks
headline.print_headline: Turnout Is Thin in Burundi Vote After Night of Unrest

snippet: Despite international calls for the postponement of parliamentary and local balloting, the government pressed ahead, saying that a delay would only add to instability.
